Description:
Key Responsibilities:Supervises, leads, and develops assigned employees.
Trains assigned employees to meet operational, safety and company and government regulatory and safety criteria.
Responsible for monthly grain inventory measurements.
Responsible for grain handling including incoming, stored, and outgoing grain. Maintains the grain quality, blending, and providing grain drying services.
In coordination with Sales Managers and operations, oversees the production, management and distribution of and seed inventories.
Provides professional customer service that result in increased sales.
Ensures the maximum utilization efficiency of storage and grain handling equipment.
Acts as a liaison for the department between branches and other company departments.
Responsible for compliance (or exceeding) all operational, quality, government, regulatory and health and safety regulations as well as the maintenance and professional appearance of equipment, rolling stock and facilities.
In collaboration Senior Management, ensure record keeping adheres to all required legislation.
Prepare and present monthly reports as directed by the General Manager with regards to HR, financial statements and other data
Follow direction to complete other tasks and projects as required.
All other duties as assigned.Skills
Skills:
A degree or diploma in Ag Economics, Ag Marketing or Agri-Business, or engineering a combination of related education and experience.
3+ years of supervisory experience demonstrating the ability to provide successful leadership for location management.
Prior experience in the agricultural industry with grain and crop inputs is required.
Proficient in MS Office Suite programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) as well as additional web-based sites, and the ability to quickly learn and utilize new software.

Data.Company Industry: Manufacturing; Food & Beverage Production; Animal Production
